At this time, we are not able to offer you admission. With only one available seat, we must continue to reserve capacity in accordance with our established priority order for this admissions round, and we are not yet in a position to move to your place on that list.

We appreciate your persistence and encourage you to continue pursuing other options in parallel as the process continues.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list ranks Student_E below Student_B, Student_A, and Student_D, and I have quota 1. Student_E has applied repeatedly, but accepting now would forgo the chance to match with any higher-priority student if they later apply (even if unlikely). I still have capacity and no commitment yet, so to maximize my outcome per true priorities, I should continue to hold the seat for higher-priority candidates and reject Student_E this round as before.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

I’m Student_E, and I’m writing to formally apply again this round. School_C remains my first choice, and if you are able to offer me the seat at any point, I will accept immediately and enroll.

I understand you must follow your priority order and have only one seat. If any higher-priority candidates have already matched elsewhere or do not apply/accept for School_C this round, I would be very grateful to be considered for the opening.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Although I have been repeatedly rejected due to priority order, continuing to apply is the only way to possibly secure the seat if higher-priority students have matched elsewhere or stop pursuing School_C. I will submit a concise, clear application emphasizing immediate commitment to enroll if offered.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_C and for your formal application this round. Given the current stage of the process and our available capacity, we are able to offer you admission.

If you still wish to enroll at School_C, we are pleased to welcome you.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list but ranked 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). We still have quota 1 and are currently unmatched. Given the market information: Student_B ranks School_C as 2nd (after School_E), Student_A ranks School_C last, Student_D ranks School_C last, Student_C ranks School_C 2nd but is not on our acceptable list, and Student_E ranks us 1st. Holding out could, in theory, yield Student_B, but after 13 rounds Student_B has not applied to us, and Student_A/Student_D are very unlikely to ever apply given they place us last. Continuing to reject Student_E risks ending unmatched if Student_B never comes. Accepting Student_E now secures a match with an acceptable candidate on our list, which is preferable to remaining unfilled at the end.
